title: 110_s1582
content:
The Act is titled the "Hydrographic Services Improvement Act Amendments of 2008" and includes definitions. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892) is amended to define hydrographic data as information acquired through various surveying methods and used in providing hydrographic services. Hydrographic services include the management, maintenance, interpretation, and dissemination of various types of information for the production of nautical charts and databases. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 defines hydrographic data as information used for nautical chart production, nautical information systems development, and related activities. The Coast and Geodetic Survey Act refers to the functions and duties of the Coast and Geodetic Survey. SEC. 3. FUNCTIONS OF THE ADMINISTRATOR. Section 303 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892a) is amended to include provisions for the Administrator to procure, operate vessels and equipment, and provide hydrographic services to promote safe marine transportation. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to allow the Administrator to design, install, and operate hydrographic monitoring systems for navigation safety, acquire data for coastal resource management, respond to emergencies, and collaborate with other agencies. The Administrator is authorized to establish hydrographic monitoring systems and collaborate with other agencies for data acquisition and emergency response, in accordance with relevant laws. SEC. 4. HYDROGRAPHIC SERVICES REVIEW PANEL. The panel consists of 15 voting members appointed by the Administrator, with nonvoting members including the Co-directors of the Center for Coastal and Ocean Mapping/Joint Hydrographic Center and up to 2 NOAA employees. Voting members are experts in disciplines related to hydrographic data, marine transportation, port administration, and other relevant fields as determined by the Administrator.

SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 306 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for hydrographic services. The Administrator is authorized to appropriate funds for nautical mapping, charting, hydrographic surveys, contracting for surveys, operating survey vessels, and geodetic functions for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. For fiscal years 2009 to 2012, funds are allocated for nautical mapping, charting, hydrographic surveys, and acquiring a replacement hydrographic survey vessel. The specific amounts are outlined for each year. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZED NOAA CORPS STRENGTH: The total number of authorized commissioned officers in the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Commissioned Officer Corps will increase from 321 to 379 effective October 1, 2009, subject to certain conditions being met.
